GeneralInformation.School Vision: A dynamic school that thinks and cares.
GeneralInformation.School Mission: We nurture citizens of character with the passion to contribute and excel.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Evergreen Secondary School wants to nurture our students to become Caring Leaders and Thinking Citizens. We endeavour to know every child, support them in exploring their own strengths, and affirm them of their abilities to make a difference. We believe every student who aspires to do well can succeed given the right support from parents and teachers. We recognise the importance of forging effective partnerships with our parents in addition to building a team of dedicated and competent teachers.  In preparing our students for the challenges of the 21st Century, our curriculum is innovative and forward-looking, and is undergirded by sound values. A dynamic school that thinks and cares, Evergreen Secondary School has put in place quality programmes that take into consideration student aspirations, interests, and talents. Students will be nurtured to develop a passion in what they do, and a belief that they can contribute and excel wherever they are.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: Government School / Co-ed School / Single Session

School Distinctive Programmes.Languages & Humanities: Developing Effective Communicators, Caring Leaders and Inventive Thinking through National Education
School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Strengthening Resilience and Character through Leadership and Sports Education

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Our Applied Learning Programme (ALP English Language) develops all students into Effective Communicators, Caring Leaders and Inventive Thinkers through a 3-year Communications Curriculum. Through Effective Reading, Debates and Presentations, students develop analytical, critical thinking, collaboration and oratorical skills. Talent development programmes such as the Model United Nations, e-Journalism and the Odyssey of the Mind, allow students to further hone their interest. From 2020, we are one of four schools offering the Enhanced ALP (Mother Tongue Languages). Over a 3-year curriculum, Chinese and Malay Language students are exposed to a range of experiences such as traditional medicine, public speaking, debates, creative compositions and song-writing, to develop a deeper appreciation of their Mother Tongue. Our Learning for Life Programme (LLP) is a 4/5-year experience that focuses on Strengthening Resilience, Character and Leadership through Sports Education. We aim to nurture all students to become thinking and caring leaders who take personal responsibility for maintaining an active and healthy lifestyle. Students experience a broad-based PE curriculum and authentic applications of lessons on resilience and leadership through outdoor programmes, CCA and working with partners. A comprehensive 4-year Service Learning structure provides opportunities for students to engage with, and serve the community. This empowerment allows them to internalise values and sharpen leadership skills. The school also offers a structured Science and Technology Research Programme to stretch the potential of students with deep interest in Science, by providing them with opportunities to work on research projects under the guidance of dedicated teachers. Another feature of the school is its rich CCA experiences. With a variety of exciting and quality CCAs to choose from, students will find their schooling experience enriching and memorable.
